intro: Castelnavia monandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which are usually violet or purple in color, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Castelnavia monandra is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
